intro: Ervum amoenum, commonly known as the dwarf vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its root system is well-developed, allowing it to thrive in various soil types. The plant is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and fields, and is valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
